% solutions to exercises
% supplementary notes, basic probability
% spring 2011


\subsection*{Probability Solutions}

\begin{enumerate}

\item   $P(\mbox{even gender split}) = {4 \choose 2}/16 = 6/16 = 3/8$\\
  $P(\mbox{3-1 gender split}) =  2{4 \choose 3}/16 = 8/16 = 1/2$, the greater
  of the two

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item 
  \begin{eqnarray*}
& &     P(\mbox{2 draws different})\\
&=&   P(\mbox{1st draw is a letter AND 2nd draw is something else})\\
  &=& P(\mbox{1st draw is a letter})P(\mbox{2nd is something else} | \mbox{1st is something})\\
  &=& 1 \cdot 4/5 = 4/5
  \end{eqnarray*}
\item 
  \begin{eqnarray*}
& &     P(\mbox{at least one vowel})\\
 &=& 1 - P(\mbox{no vowels})\\
  &=& 1 - P(\mbox{2 consonants})\\
  &=& 1 - P(\mbox{1st draw consonant AND 2nd draw consonant})\\
  &=& 1 - 3/5 \cdot 3/5 = 16/25
  \end{eqnarray*}
\item $P(\mbox{2 draws different})=1$, 
  \begin{eqnarray*}
& &     P(\mbox{at least one vowel})\\
 &=& 1 - P(\mbox{no vowels})\\
  &=& 1 - P(\mbox{2 consonants})\\
  &=& 1 - P(\mbox{1st draw consonant AND 2nd draw consonant})\\
  &=& 1 - P(\mbox{1st draw consonant})P(\mbox{2nd draw consonant} | \mbox{1st draw consonant})\\
  &=& 1 - 3/5 \cdot 2/4 = 7/10
  \end{eqnarray*}
\end{enumerate}

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(\mbox{no diamonds}) = 39/52 \cdot 38/51 \cdot 37/50 \cdot 36/49$
\item $P(\mbox{all diamonds}) = 13/52 \cdot 12/51 \cdot 11/50 \cdot 10/49$
\item $ P(\mbox{all same suit}) = 4 \cdot\mbox{(above)}$
\end{enumerate}

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item (with replacement)
$  P(\mbox{exactly 3 R in 4 draws}) = {4 \choose 3} \cdot (1/6)^3 \cdot 5/6$
\item (without replacement)
$  P(\mbox{exactly 3 R in 4 draws}) = 0$
\end{enumerate}

\item  
\begin{enumerate}
\item $ 3^5 = 243$
\item ${5 \choose 2} \cdot 2^3 = 80$
\item $P(E) = {5 \choose 2} \cdot (2/9)^2 \cdot (7/9)^3 \approx .232$,
        this does not equal $80/243 \approx .329$
\item $P(F) = {5 \choose 2} \cdot (4/9)^2 \cdot (5/9)^3 \approx .339$,\\
        $|E \cap F| = {5 \choose 2}\cdot{3 \choose 2} = 30$,\\
        $P(E \cap F) = 30 \cdot (2/9)^2 \cdot (4/9)^2 \cdot 3/9 \approx .098$,\\
        $P(E \cap F)$ does not equal $P(E)P(F)$, so $E,F$ are dependent
\end{enumerate}

\item  
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(\mbox{100 T} | \mbox{at least 99 T}) = 1/101$
\item $P(\mbox{100 T} | \mbox{first 99 T}) = 1/2$
\end{enumerate}

\item $P(\mbox{win lottery}) = 1/{36 \choose 6}$

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(\mbox{RRBB}) = 26/52 \cdot 25/51 \cdot 26/50 \cdot 25/49$
\item $P(\mbox{exactly 2R}) = {4 \choose 2} \cdot\mbox{(above)}$
\end{enumerate}

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(E) = {5 \choose 3}(.54)^3 (.46)^2$
\item $P(F) = (.54)^2$
\item Event $E \cap F$ consists of the 3 outcomes RRBBR, RBRBR, and
     RBBRR.  Each of these outcomes has probability $(.54)^3(.46)^2$,
     so $P(E \cap F) = 3(.54)^3(.46)^2$, which does not equal
     $P(E)P(F)$, so we conclude that $E$ and $F$ are dependent.
\end{enumerate}


\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(\mbox{all rolls even}) = (1/2)^5 = 1/32  \approx .0313$
\item $P(\mbox{not all rolls even}) = 1 - 1/32 \approx .969$
\item $P(\mbox{all rolls odd}) = 1/32 \approx .0313$
\item $P(\mbox{exactly 3 even}) = {5 \choose 3} (1/2)^3 (1/2)^2 \approx .313$
\end{enumerate}

\item $P(c) = 1/6$, $P(d) = 1/12$

\item  
\begin{enumerate}
\item
  \begin{eqnarray*}
  & & P(\mbox{both black OR both hearts})\\
  &=& P(\mbox{both black}) + P(\mbox{both hearts})\\
  &=& 26/52 \cdot 25/51  +  13/52 \cdot 12/51    
  \end{eqnarray*}
\item
  \begin{eqnarray*}
& &  P(\mbox{both black OR both aces}) \\
  &=& P(\mbox{both black}) + P(\mbox{both aces}) - P(\mbox{both black aces})\\
  &=& 26/52 \cdot 25/51 + 4/52 \cdot 3/51  - 2/52 \cdot 1/51
  \end{eqnarray*}
\end{enumerate}

 \item 
 \begin{eqnarray*}
 P(\mbox{draw at least one K in N draws}) &=& 1 - P(\mbox{draw no K in N draws})\\
 &=& 1 - (12/13)^N
 \end{eqnarray*}
   So we want to solve $1 - (12/13)^N \geq .7$, or equivalently
                       $.3 \leq (12/13)^N$.
   You can find $N$ by trial and error, or solve as follows.
\begin{eqnarray*}
\log(.3) &\leq& N \log(12/13)\hspace*{.1in}   \mbox{(take log both sides)}\\
\log(.3) / \log(12/13) &\geq& N   \hspace*{.1in}   \mbox{(divide both sides by $\log(12/13)$)}
\end{eqnarray*}
   Get $N$ slightly less than 16, so the smallest whole number solution is
   $N= 16$.

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item   Dependent.  $P(U \cap V) = P(b) = 1/3$.  This does not equal
  $P(U)P(V) = 2/3 \cdot 2/3 = 4/9$.
\item   $P(b) = 1/2$ and $P(c) = 0$ makes $U$ and $V$ independent.
\item  $ \emptyset, \{a\}, \{b\}, \{c\}, \{a,b\}, \{a,c\}, \{b,c\}, \{a,b,c\}$
\end{enumerate}

\item 
  \begin{eqnarray*}
P(E \cup F) &=& P(E) + P(F) - P(E \cap F)\\
 &=& 2/3  + 1/3  - 2/3 \cdot 1/3 = 7/9    
  \end{eqnarray*}

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(\mbox{{\em i}}) = 1 - P(\mbox{no heads}) = 1 - (1/2)^5 = 31/32$\\
      $P(\mbox{{\em ii}}) = 1 - P(\mbox{zero H or one H})
               = 1 - (1/2)^10 - {10 \choose 1}(1/2)^10 = 1013/1024$\\
       $P(\mbox{{\em ii}})$ is greater
\item $P(\mbox{exactly 2 H in first 5 flips AND exactly 4 H in last 5 flips})$\\
       $  = {5 \choose 2}(1/2)^5  {5 \choose 4}(1/2)^5 = 50/1024 \approx .0488$
\end{enumerate}

\item 
\begin{enumerate}
\item $P(\mbox{all red}) = 26/52 \cdot 25/51 \cdot 24/50 \cdot 23/49 \cdot 22/48$
\item $P(\mbox{AKQJten diamonds in order}) =
  1/(52\cdot 51\cdot 50\cdot 49\cdot 48)$
\item $P(\mbox{AKQJten diamonds in any order}) = 5!\cdot\mbox{(above)}$
\end{enumerate}

\item ${5 \choose 3}(1/2)^5(1 - (1/2)^5) = 310/(32^2) \approx .303$

\end{enumerate}
